alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 3:49AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, McDonald and Stone. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway U, Greasy Creek at Farm Road 2290, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145 and Flat Creek at Highway Y. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Seligman, Exeter, Galena, Washburn, Shell Knob, Mccord Bend and Golden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
